name: 2 Kings 17:26
text: Therefore they spoke to the king of Assyria, saying, "The nations which you have carried away, and placed in the cities of Samaria, don"t know the law of the god of the land. Therefore he has sent lions among them, and behold, they kill them, because they don"t know the law of the god of the land."

name: 2 Kings 17:27
text: Then the king of Assyria commanded, saying, "Carry there one of the priests whom you brought from there; and let them go and dwell there, and let him teach them the law of the god of the land."

name: 2 Kings 17:28
text: So one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and lived in Bethel, and taught them how they should fear Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 17:29
text: However every nation made gods of their own, and put them in the houses of the high places which the Samaritans had made, every nation in their cities in which they lived.

name: 2 Kings 17:30
text: The men of Babylon made Succoth Benoth, and the men of Cuth made Nergal, and the men of Hamath made Ashima,

name: 2 Kings 17:31
text: and the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak; and the Sepharvites burnt their children in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

name: 2 Kings 17:32
text: So they feared Yahweh, and made to them from among themselves priests of the high places, who sacrificed for them in the houses of the high places.

name: 2 Kings 17:33
text: They feared Yahweh, and served their own gods, after the ways of the nations from among whom they had been carried away.

name: 2 Kings 17:34
text: To this day they do what they did before: they don"t fear Yahweh, neither do they follow their statutes, or their ordinances, or the law or the commandment which Yahweh commanded the children of Jacob, whom he named Israel;

name: 2 Kings 17:35
text: with whom Yahweh had made a covenant, and commanded them, saying, "You shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them;

name: 2 Kings 17:36
text: but you shall fear Yahweh, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and with an outstretched arm, and you shall bow yourselves to him, and you shall sacrifice to him.

name: 2 Kings 17:37
text: The statutes and the ordinances, and the law and the commandment, which he wrote for you, you shall observe to do forevermore. You shall not fear other gods.

name: 2 Kings 17:38
text: You shall not forget the covenant that I have made with you; neither shall you fear other gods.

name: 2 Kings 17:39
text: But you shall fear Yahweh your God; and he will deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies."

name: 2 Kings 17:40
text: However they did not listen, but they did what they did before.

name: 2 Kings 17:41
text: So these nations feared Yahweh, and served their engraved images. Their children likewise, and their children"s children, as their fathers did, so they do to this day.

name: 2 Kings 18:1
text: Now it happened in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.

name: 2 Kings 18:2
text: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Abi the daughter of Zechariah.

name: 2 Kings 18:3
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, according to all that David his father had done.

name: 2 Kings 18:4
text: He removed the high places, and broke the pillars, and cut down the Asherah: and he broke in pieces the bronze serpent that Moses had made; for in those days the children of Israel burned incense to it; and he called it Nehushtan.

name: 2 Kings 18:5
text: He trusted in Yahweh, the God of Israel; so that after him was none like him among all the kings of Judah, nor among them that were before him.

name: 2 Kings 18:6
text: For he joined with Yahweh; he didn"t depart from following him, but kept his commandments, which Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: 2 Kings 18:7
text: Yahweh was with him; wherever he went forth he prospered: and he rebelled against the king of Assyria, and didn"t serve him.

name: 2 Kings 18:8
text: He struck the Philistines to Gaza and its borders, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city.

name: 2 Kings 18:9
text: It happened in the fourth year of king Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria, and besieged it.

name: 2 Kings 18:10
text: At the end of three years they took it: in the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken.

name: 2 Kings 18:11
text: The king of Assyria carried Israel away to Assyria, and put them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes,

name: 2 Kings 18:12
text: because they didn"t obey the voice of Yahweh their God, but transgressed his covenant, even all that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded, and would not hear it, nor do it.

name: 2 Kings 18:13
text: Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah, and took them.

name: 2 Kings 18:14
text: Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria to Lachish, saying, "I have offended; return from me. That which you put on me, I will bear." The king of Assyria appointed to Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.

name: 2 Kings 18:15
text: Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of Yahweh, and in the treasures of the king"s house.

name: 2 Kings 18:16
text: At that time, Hezekiah cut off the gold from the doors of the temple of Yahweh, and from the pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid, and gave it to the king of Assyria.

name: 2 Kings 18:17
text: The king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great army to Jerusalem. They went up and came to Jerusalem. When they had come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fuller"s field.

name: 2 Kings 18:18
text: When they had called to the king, there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebnah the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.

name: 2 Kings 18:19
text: Rabshakeh said to them, "Say now to Hezekiah, "Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria, "What confidence is this in which you trust?

name: 2 Kings 18:20
text: You say (but they are but vain words), "There is counsel and strength for war." Now on whom do you trust, that you have rebelled against me?

name: 2 Kings 18:21
text: Now, behold, you trust in the staff of this bruised reed, even in Egypt. If a man leans on it, it will go into his hand, and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust on him.

name: 2 Kings 18:22
text: But if you tell me, "We trust in Yahweh our God;" isn"t that he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and has said to Judah and to Jerusalem, "You shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem?"

name: 2 Kings 18:23
text: Now therefore, please give pledges to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to set riders on them.

name: 2 Kings 18:24
text: How then can you turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master"s servants, and put your trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

name: 2 Kings 18:25
text: Have I now come up without Yahweh against this place to destroy it? Yahweh said to me, "Go up against this land, and destroy it.""""

name: 2 Kings 18:26
text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, and Shebnah, and Joah, said to Rabshakeh, "Please speak to your servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it. Don"t speak with us in the Jews" language, in the hearing of the people who are on the wall."

name: 2 Kings 18:27
text: But Rabshakeh said to them, "Has my master sent me to your master, and to you, to speak these words? Hasn"t he sent me to the men who sit on the wall, to eat their own dung, and to drink their own water with you?"

name: 2 Kings 18:28
text: Then Rabshakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews" language, and spoke, saying, "Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria.

name: 2 Kings 18:29
text: Thus says the king, "Don"t let Hezekiah deceive you; for he will not be able to deliver you out of his hand.

name: 2 Kings 18:30
text: Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in Yahweh, saying, "Yahweh will surely deliver us, and this city shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria."

name: 2 Kings 18:31
text: Don"t listen to Hezekiah." For thus says the king of Assyria, "Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and everyone of you eat of his vine, and everyone of his fig tree, and everyone drink the waters of his own cistern;

name: 2 Kings 18:32
text: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive trees and of honey, that you may live, and not die. Don"t listen to Hezekiah, when he persuades you, saying, "Yahweh will deliver us."

name: 2 Kings 18:33
text: Has any of the gods of the nations ever delivered his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

name: 2 Kings 18:34
text: Where are the gods of Hamath, and of Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah? Have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?

name: 2 Kings 18:35
text: Who are they among all the gods of the countries, that have delivered their country out of my hand, that Yahweh should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?""

name: 2 Kings 18:36
text: But the people held their peace, and answered him not a word; for the king"s commandment was, "Don"t answer him."

name: 2 Kings 18:37
text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, came with Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.

name: 2 Kings 19:1
text: It happened, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he tore his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 19:2
text: He sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.

name: 2 Kings 19:3
text: They said to him, "Thus says Hezekiah, "This day is a day of trouble, of rebuke, and of rejection; for the children have come to the point of birth, and there is no strength to deliver them.

name: 2 Kings 19:4
text: It may be Yahweh your God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master has sent to defy the living God, and will rebuke the words which Yahweh your God has heard. Therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.""

name: 2 Kings 19:5
text: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

name: 2 Kings 19:6
text: Isaiah said to them, "Thus you shall tell your master, "Thus says Yahweh, "Don"t be afraid of the words that you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

name: 2 Kings 19:7
text: Behold, I will put a spirit in him, and he will hear news, and will return to his own land. I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land."""

name: 2 Kings 19:8
text: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah; for he had heard that he had departed from Lachish.

name: 2 Kings 19:9
text: When he heard it said of Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, "Behold, he has come out to fight against you, he sent messengers again to Hezekiah, saying,

name: 2 Kings 19:10
text: "Thus you shall speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, "Don"t let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, Jerusalem will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.

name: 2 Kings 19:11
text: Behold, you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly. Will you be delivered?

name: 2 Kings 19:12
text: Have the gods of the nations delivered them, which my fathers have destroyed, Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden that were in Telassar?

name: 2 Kings 19:13
text: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah?"""

name: 2 Kings 19:14
text: Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it. Then Hezekiah went up to the house of Yahweh, and spread it before Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 19:15
text: Hezekiah prayed before Yahweh, and said, "Yahweh, the God of Israel, who sit above the cherubim, you are the God, even you alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.

name: 2 Kings 19:16
text: Incline your ear, Yahweh, and hear. Open your eyes, Yahweh, and see. Hear the words of Sennacherib, with which he has sent to defy the living God.

name: 2 Kings 19:17
text: Truly, Yahweh, the kings of Assyria have laid waste the nations and their lands,

name: 2 Kings 19:18
text: and have cast their gods into the fire; for they were no gods, but the work of men"s hands, wood and stone. Therefore they have destroyed them.

name: 2 Kings 19:19
text: Now therefore, Yahweh our God, save us, I beg you, out of his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you, Yahweh, are God alone."

name: 2 Kings 19:20
text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "Whereas you have prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria, I have heard you.

name: 2 Kings 19:21
text: This is the word that Yahweh has spoken concerning him: "The virgin daughter of Zion has despised you and ridiculed you. The daughter of Jerusalem has shaken her head at you.

name: 2 Kings 19:22
text: Whom have you defied and blasphemed? Against whom have you exalted your voice and lifted up your eyes on high? Against the Holy One of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 19:23
text: By your messengers you have defied the Lord, and have said, "With the multitude of my chariots, I have come up to the height of the mountains, to the innermost parts of Lebanon; and I will cut down its tall cedars, and its choice fir trees; and I will enter into his farthest lodging place, the forest of his fruitful field.

name: 2 Kings 19:24
text: I have dug and drunk strange waters, and with the sole of my feet will I dry up all the rivers of Egypt."

name: 2 Kings 19:25
text: Haven"t you heard how I have done it long ago, and formed it of ancient times? Now have I brought it to pass, that it should be yours to lay waste fortified cities into ruinous heaps.

name: 2 Kings 19:26
text: Therefore their inhabitants were of small power. They were dismayed and confounded. They were like the grass of the field, and like the green herb, like the grass on the housetops, and like grain blasted before it has grown up.

name: 2 Kings 19:27
text: But I know your sitting down, and your going out, and your coming in, and your raging against me.

name: 2 Kings 19:28
text: Because of your raging against me, and because your arrogance has come up into my ears, therefore will I put my hook in your nose, and my bridle in your lips, and I will turn you back by the way by which you came."

name: 2 Kings 19:29
text: ""This shall be the sign to you: You shall eat this year that which grows of itself, and in the second year that which springs of the same; and in the third year sow, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat its fruit.

name: 2 Kings 19:30
text: The remnant that has escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

name: 2 Kings 19:31
text: For out of Jerusalem a remnant will go out, and out of Mount Zion those who shall escape. The zeal of Yahweh will perform this."

name: 2 Kings 19:32
text: "Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning the king of Assyria, "He shall not come to this city, nor shoot an arrow there, neither shall he come before it with shield, nor cast up a mound against it.

name: 2 Kings 19:33
text: By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and he shall not come to this city," says Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 19:34
text: "For I will defend this city to save it, for my own sake, and for my servant David"s sake.""

name: 2 Kings 19:35
text: It happened that night, that the angel of Yahweh went out, and struck one hundred eighty-five thousand in the camp of the Assyrians. When men arose early in the morning, behold, these were all dead bodies.

name: 2 Kings 19:36
text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and lived at Nineveh.

name: 2 Kings 19:37
text: It happened, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer struck him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat. Esar Haddon his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 20:1
text: In those days was Hezekiah sick to death. Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came to him, and said to him, "Thus says Yahweh, "Set your house in order; for you shall die, and not live.""

name: 2 Kings 20:2
text: Then he turned his face to the wall, and prayed to Yahweh, saying,

name: 2 Kings 20:3
text: "Remember now, Yahweh, I beg you, how I have walked before you in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in your sight." Hezekiah wept bitterly.

name: 2 Kings 20:4
text: It happened, before Isaiah had gone out into the middle part of the city, that the word of Yahweh came to him, saying,

name: 2 Kings 20:5
text: "Turn back, and tell Hezekiah the prince of my people, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of David your father, "I have heard your prayer. I have seen your tears. Behold, I will heal you. On the third day, you shall go up to the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 20:6
text: I will add to your days fifteen years. I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria. I will defend this city for my own sake, and for my servant David"s sake."""

name: 2 Kings 20:7
text: Isaiah said, "Take a cake of figs." They took and laid it on the boil, and he recovered.

name: 2 Kings 20:8
text: Hezekiah said to Isaiah, "What shall be the sign that Yahweh will heal me, and that I shall go up to the house of Yahweh the third day?"

name: 2 Kings 20:9
text: Isaiah said, "This shall be the sign to you from Yahweh, that Yahweh will do the thing that he has spoken: shall the shadow go forward ten steps, or go back ten steps?"

name: 2 Kings 20:10
text: Hezekiah answered, "It is a light thing for the shadow to go forward ten steps. Nay, but let the shadow return backward ten steps."

name: 2 Kings 20:11
text: Isaiah the prophet cried to Yahweh; and he brought the shadow ten steps backward, by which it had gone down on the dial of Ahaz.

name: 2 Kings 20:12
text: At that time Berodach Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah; for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.

name: 2 Kings 20:13
text: Hezekiah listened to them, and showed them all the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious oil, and the house of his armor, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah didn"t show them.

name: 2 Kings 20:14
text: Then Isaiah the prophet came to king Hezekiah, and said to him, "What did these men say? From where did they come to you?" Hezekiah said, "They have come from a far country, even from Babylon."

name: 2 Kings 20:15
text: He said, "What have they seen in your house?" Hezekiah answered, "They have seen all that is in my house. There is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them."

name: 2 Kings 20:16
text: Isaiah said to Hezekiah, "Hear the word of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 20:17
text: "Behold, the days come, that all that is in your house, and that which your fathers have laid up in store to this day, shall be carried to Babylon. Nothing shall be left," says Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 20:18
text: "Of your sons who shall issue from you, whom you shall father, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.""

name: 2 Kings 20:19
text: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, "The word of Yahweh which you have spoken is good." He said moreover, "Isn"t it so, if peace and truth shall be in my days?"

name: 2 Kings 20:20
text: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and all his might, and how he made the pool, and the conduit, and brought water into the city, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 20:21
text: Hezekiah slept with his fathers; and Manasseh his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 21:1
text: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Hephzibah.

name: 2 Kings 21:2
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, after the abominations of the nations whom Yahweh cast out before the children of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 21:3
text: For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had destroyed; and he reared up altars for Baal, and made an Asherah, as did Ahab king of Israel, and worshiped all the army of the sky, and served them.

name: 2 Kings 21:4
text: He built altars in the house of Yahweh, of which Yahweh said, "I will put my name in Jerusalem."

name: 2 Kings 21:5
text: He built altars for all the army of the sky in the two courts of the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 21:6
text: He made his son to pass through the fire, and practiced sorcery, and used enchantments, and dealt with those who had familiar spirits, and with wizards: he worked much evil in the sight of Yahweh, to provoke him to anger.

name: 2 Kings 21:7
text: He set the engraved image of Asherah, that he had made, in the house of which Yahweh said to David and to Solomon his son, "In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, will I put my name forever;

name: 2 Kings 21:8
text: neither will I cause the feet of Israel to wander any more out of the land which I gave their fathers, if only they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that my servant Moses commanded them."

name: 2 Kings 21:9
text: But they didn"t listen: and Manasseh seduced them to do that which is evil more than the nations did whom Yahweh destroyed before the children of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 21:10
text: Yahweh spoke by his servants the prophets, saying,

name: 2 Kings 21:11
text: "Because Manasseh king of Judah has done these abominations, and has done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, who were before him, and has made Judah also to sin with his idols;

name: 2 Kings 21:12
text: therefore thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "Behold, I bring such evil on Jerusalem and Judah, that whoever hears of it, both his ears shall tingle.

name: 2 Kings 21:13
text: I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab; and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipes a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down.

name: 2 Kings 21:14
text: I will cast off the remnant of my inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies. They will become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies;

name: 2 Kings 21:15
text: because they have done that which is evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even to this day.""

name: 2 Kings 21:16
text: Moreover Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, until he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another; besides his sin with which he made Judah to sin, in doing that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 21:17
text: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all that he did, and his sin that he sinned, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 21:18
text: Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza: and Amon his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 21:19
text: Amon was twenty-two years old when he began to reign; and he reigned two years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Meshullemeth the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.

name: 2 Kings 21:20
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, as Manasseh his father did.

name: 2 Kings 21:21
text: He walked in all the way that his father walked in, and served the idols that his father served, and worshiped them:

name: 2 Kings 21:22
text: and he forsook Yahweh, the God of his fathers, and didn"t walk in the way of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 21:23
text: The servants of Amon conspired against him, and put the king to death in his own house.

name: 2 Kings 21:24
text: But the people of the land killed all those who had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his place.

name: 2 Kings 21:25
text: Now the rest of the acts of Amon which he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 21:26
text: He was buried in his tomb in the garden of Uzza: and Josiah his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 22:1
text: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign; and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Jedidah the daughter of Adaiah of Bozkath.

name: 2 Kings 22:2
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, and walked in all the way of David his father, and didn"t turn aside to the right hand or to the left.

name: 2 Kings 22:3
text: It happened in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, that the king sent Shaphan, the son of Azaliah the son of Meshullam, the scribe, to the house of Yahweh, saying,

name: 2 Kings 22:4
text: "Go up to Hilkiah the high priest, that he may sum the money which is brought into the house of Yahweh, which the keepers of the threshold have gathered of the people.

name: 2 Kings 22:5
text: Let them deliver it into the hand of the workmen who have the oversight of the house of Yahweh; and let them give it to the workmen who are in the house of Yahweh, to repair the breaches of the house,

name: 2 Kings 22:6
text: to the carpenters, and to the builders, and to the masons, and for buying timber and cut stone to repair the house.

name: 2 Kings 22:7
text: However there was no accounting made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand; for they dealt faithfully."

name: 2 Kings 22:8
text: Hilkiah the high priest said to Shaphan the scribe, "I have found the book of the law in the house of Yahweh." Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan, and he read it.

name: 2 Kings 22:9
text: Shaphan the scribe came to the king, and brought the king word again, and said, "Your servants have emptied out the money that was found in the house, and have delivered it into the hand of the workmen who have the oversight of the house of Yahweh."

name: 2 Kings 22:10
text: Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, "Hilkiah the priest has delivered a book to me." Shaphan read it before the king.

name: 2 Kings 22:11
text: It happened, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he tore his clothes.

name: 2 Kings 22:12
text: The king commanded Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Achbor the son of Micaiah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the king"s servant, saying,

name: 2 Kings 22:13
text: "Go inquire of Yahweh for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found; for great is the wrath of Yahweh that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not listened to the words of this book, to do according to all that which is written concerning us."

name: 2 Kings 22:14
text: So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asaiah, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe (now she lived in Jerusalem in the second quarter); and they talked with her.

name: 2 Kings 22:15
text: She said to them, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: "Tell the man who sent you to me,

name: 2 Kings 22:16
text: "Thus says Yahweh, "Behold, I will bring evil on this place, and on its inhabitants, even all the words of the book which the king of Judah has read.

name: 2 Kings 22:17
text: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the work of their hands, therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place, and it shall not be quenched.""

name: 2 Kings 22:18
text: But to the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of Yahweh, thus you shall tell him, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: "Concerning the words which you have heard,

name: 2 Kings 22:19
text: because your heart was tender, and you humbled yourself before Yahweh, when you heard what I spoke against this place, and against its inhabitants, that they should become a desolation and a curse, and have torn your clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard you," says Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 22:20
text: "Therefore, behold, I will gather you to your fathers, and you shall be gathered to your grave in peace, neither shall your eyes see all the evil which I will bring on this place."""" They brought back this message to the king.

name: 2 Kings 23:1
text: The king sent, and they gathered to him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.

name: 2 Kings 23:2
text: The king went up to the house of Yahweh, and all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the people, both small and great: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 23:3
text: The king stood by the pillar, and made a covenant before Yahweh, to walk after Yahweh, and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and all his soul, to confirm the words of this covenant that were written in this book: and all the people stood to the covenant.

name: 2 Kings 23:4
text: The king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the threshold, to bring forth out of the temple of Yahweh all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the Asherah, and for all the army of the sky, and he burned them outside of Jerusalem in the fields of the Kidron, and carried their ashes to Bethel.

name: 2 Kings 23:5
text: He put down the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places around Jerusalem; those also who burned incense to Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets, and to all the army of the sky.

name: 2 Kings 23:6
text: He brought out the Asherah from the house of Yahweh, outside of Jerusalem, to the brook Kidron, and burned it at the brook Kidron, and beat it to dust, and cast its dust on the graves of the common people.

name: 2 Kings 23:7
text: He broke down the houses of the sodomites, that were in the house of Yahweh, where the women wove hangings for the Asherah.

name: 2 Kings 23:8
text: He brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba; and he broke down the high places of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man"s left hand at the gate of the city.

name: 2 Kings 23:9
text: Nevertheless the priests of the high places didn"t come up to the altar of Yahweh in Jerusalem, but they ate unleavened bread among their brothers.

name: 2 Kings 23:10
text: He defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the children of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.

name: 2 Kings 23:11
text: He took away the horses that the kings of Judah had given to the sun, at the entrance of the house of Yahweh, by the room of Nathan Melech the officer, who was in the court; and he burned the chariots of the sun with fire.

name: 2 Kings 23:12
text: The king broke down the altars that were on the roof of the upper room of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars which Manasseh had made in the two courts of the house of Yahweh, and beat them down from there, and cast their dust into the brook Kidron.

name: 2 Kings 23:13
text: The the king defiled the high places that were before Jerusalem, which were on the right hand of the mountain of corruption, which Solomon the king of Israel had built for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Sidonians, and for Chemosh the abomination of Moab, and for Milcom the abomination of the children of Ammon.

name: 2 Kings 23:14
text: He broke in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Asherim, and filled their places with the bones of men.

name: 2 Kings 23:15
text: Moreover the altar that was at Bethel, and the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, even that altar and the high place he broke down; and he burned the high place and beat it to dust, and burned the Asherah.

name: 2 Kings 23:16
text: As Josiah turned himself, he spied the tombs that were there in the mountain; and he sent, and took the bones out of the tombs, and burned them on the altar, and defiled it, according to the word of Yahweh which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these things.

name: 2 Kings 23:17
text: Then he said, "What monument is that which I see?" The men of the city told him, "It is the tomb of the man of God, who came from Judah, and proclaimed these things that you have done against the altar of Bethel."

name: 2 Kings 23:18
text: He said, "Let him be! Let no man move his bones." So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet who came out of Samaria.

name: 2 Kings 23:19
text: All the houses also of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke Yahweh to anger, Josiah took away, and did to them according to all the acts that he had done in Bethel.

name: 2 Kings 23:20
text: He killed all the priests of the high places that were there, on the altars, and burned men"s bones on them; and he returned to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Kings 23:21
text: The king commanded all the people, saying, "Keep the Passover to Yahweh your God, as it is written in this book of the covenant."

name: 2 Kings 23:22
text: Surely there was not kept such a Passover from the days of the judges who judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel, nor of the kings of Judah;

name: 2 Kings 23:23
text: but in the eighteenth year of king Josiah was this Passover kept to Yahweh in Jerusalem.

name: 2 Kings 23:24
text: Moreover Josiah removed those who had familiar spirits, and the wizards, and the teraphim, and the idols, and all the abominations that were seen in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, that he might confirm the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 23:25
text: Like him was there no king before him, who turned to Yahweh with all his heart, and with all his soul, and with all his might, according to all the law of Moses; neither after him arose there any like him.

name: 2 Kings 23:26
text: Notwithstanding, Yahweh didn"t turn from the fierceness of his great wrath, with which his anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocation with which Manasseh had provoked him.

name: 2 Kings 23:27
text: Yahweh said, "I will remove Judah also out of my sight, as I have removed Israel, and I will cast off this city which I have chosen, even Jerusalem, and the house of which I said, "My name shall be there.""

name: 2 Kings 23:28
text: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 23:29
text: In his days Pharaoh Necoh king of Egypt went up against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates: and king Josiah went against him; and Pharaoh Necoh killed him at Megiddo, when he had seen him.

name: 2 Kings 23:30
text: His servants carried him in a chariot dead from Megiddo, and brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own tomb. The people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and anointed him, and made him king in his father"s place.

name: 2 Kings 23:31
text: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

name: 2 Kings 23:32
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, according to all that his fathers had done.

name: 2 Kings 23:33
text: Pharaoh Necoh put him in bonds at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem; and put the land to a tribute of one hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.

name: 2 Kings 23:34
text: Pharaoh Necoh made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in the place of Josiah his father, and changed his name to Jehoiakim: but he took Jehoahaz away; and he came to Egypt, and died there.

name: 2 Kings 23:35
text: Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh: he exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, of everyone according to his taxation, to give it to Pharaoh Necoh.

name: 2 Kings 23:36
text: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Zebidah the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

name: 2 Kings 23:37
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, according to all that his fathers had done.

name: 2 Kings 24:1
text: In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant three years: then he turned and rebelled against him.

name: 2 Kings 24:2
text: Yahweh sent against him bands of the Chaldeans, and bands of the Syrians, and bands of the Moabites, and bands of the children of Ammon, and sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke by his servants the prophets.

name: 2 Kings 24:3
text: Surely at the commandment of Yahweh came this on Judah, to remove them out of his sight, for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he did,

name: 2 Kings 24:4
text: and also for the innocent blood that he shed; for he filled Jerusalem with innocent blood: and Yahweh would not pardon.

name: 2 Kings 24:5
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 24:6
text: So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers; and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 24:7
text: The king of Egypt didn"t come again out of his land any more; for the king of Babylon had taken, from the brook of Egypt to the river Euphrates, all that pertained to the king of Egypt.

name: 2 Kings 24:8
text: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he began to reign; and he reigned in Jerusalem three months: and his mother"s name was Nehushta the daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.

name: 2 Kings 24:9
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, according to all that his father had done.

name: 2 Kings 24:10
text: At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up to Jerusalem, and the city was besieged.

name: 2 Kings 24:11
text: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to the city, while his servants were besieging it;

name: 2 Kings 24:12
text: and Jehoiachin the king of Judah went out to the king of Babylon, he, and his mother, and his servants, and his princes, and his officers: and the king of Babylon took him in the eighth year of his reign.

name: 2 Kings 24:13
text: He carried out there all the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the king"s house, and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold, which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of Yahweh, as Yahweh had said.

name: 2 Kings 24:14
text: He carried away all Jerusalem, and all the princes, and all the mighty men of valor, even ten thousand captives, and all the craftsmen and the smiths; none remained, except the poorest sort of the people of the land.

name: 2 Kings 24:15
text: He carried away Jehoiachin to Babylon; and the king"s mother, and the king"s wives, and his officers, and the chief men of the land, carried he into captivity from Jerusalem to Babylon.

name: 2 Kings 24:16
text: All the men of might, even seven thousand, and the craftsmen and the smiths one thousand, all of them strong and apt for war, even them the king of Babylon brought captive to Babylon.

name: 2 Kings 24:17
text: The king of Babylon made Mattaniah, Jehoiachin"s father"s brother, king is his place, and changed his name to Zedekiah.

name: 2 Kings 24:18
text: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

name: 2 Kings 24:19
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.

name: 2 Kings 24:20
text: For through the anger of Yahweh, it happened in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence. Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

name: 2 Kings 25:1
text: It happened in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and encamped against it; and they built forts against it around it.

name: 2 Kings 25:2
text: So the city was besieged to the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.

name: 2 Kings 25:3
text: On the ninth day of the fourth month the famine was severe in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.

name: 2 Kings 25:4
text: Then a breach was made in the city, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king"s garden (now the Chaldeans were against the city around it); and the king went by the way of the Arabah.

name: 2 Kings 25:5
text: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.

name: 2 Kings 25:6
text: Then they took the king, and carried him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they gave judgment on him.

name: 2 Kings 25:7
text: They killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him in fetters, and carried him to Babylon.

name: 2 Kings 25:8
text: Now in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Kings 25:9
text: He burnt the house of Yahweh, and the king"s house; and all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great house, burnt he with fire.

name: 2 Kings 25:10
text: All the army of the Chaldeans, who were with the captain of the guard, broke down the walls around Jerusalem.

name: 2 Kings 25:11
text: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive the residue of the people who were left in the city, and those who fell away, who fell to the king of Babylon, and the residue of the multitude.

name: 2 Kings 25:12
text: But the captain of the guard left some of the poorest of the land to work the vineyards and fields.

name: 2 Kings 25:13
text: The Chaldeans broke up the pillars of brass that were in the house of Yahweh and the bases and the bronze sea that were in the house of Yahweh, and carried the brass pieces to Babylon.

name: 2 Kings 25:14
text: They took away the pots, the shovels, the snuffers, the spoons, and all the vessels of brass with which they ministered.

name: 2 Kings 25:15
text: The captain of the guard took away the fire pans, the basins, that which was of gold, in gold, and that which was of silver, in silver.

name: 2 Kings 25:16
text: The two pillars, the one sea, and the bases, which Solomon had made for the house of Yahweh, the brass of all these vessels was without weight.

name: 2 Kings 25:17
text: The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and a capital of brass was on it; and the height of the capital was three cubits, with network and pomegranates on the capital around it, all of brass: and like to these had the second pillar with network.

name: 2 Kings 25:18
text: The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the threshold:

name: 2 Kings 25:19
text: and out of the city he took an officer who was set over the men of war; and five men of those who saw the king"s face, who were found in the city; and the scribe, the captain of the army, who mustered the people of the land; and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the city.

name: 2 Kings 25:20
text: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.

name: 2 Kings 25:21
text: The king of Babylon struck them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.

name: 2 Kings 25:22
text: As for the people who were left in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, governor.

name: 2 Kings 25:23
text: Now when all the captains of the forces, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of the Maacathite, they and their men.

name: 2 Kings 25:24
text: Gedaliah swore to them and to their men, and said to them, "Don"t be afraid because of the servants of the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you."

name: 2 Kings 25:25
text: But it happened in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal seed came, and ten men with him, and struck Gedaliah, so that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldeans that were with him at Mizpah.

name: 2 Kings 25:26
text: All the people, both small and great, and the captains of the forces, arose, and came to Egypt; for they were afraid of the Chaldeans.

name: 2 Kings 25:27
text: It happened in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, that Evilmerodach king of Babylon, in the year that he began to reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;

name: 2 Kings 25:28
text: and he spoke kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon,

name: 2 Kings 25:29
text: and changed his prison garments. Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life:

name: 2 Kings 25:30
text: and for his allowance, there was a continual allowance given him of the king, every day a portion, all the days of his life.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:1
text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:2
text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:3
text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:4
text: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:5
text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:6
text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, and Diphath, and Togarmah.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:7
text: The sons of Javan: Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:8
text: The sons of Ham: Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:9
text: The sons of Cush: Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raama, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba, and Dedan.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:10
text: Cush became the father of Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one in the earth.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:11
text: Mizraim became the father of Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:12
text: and Pathrusim, and Casluhim (where the Philistines came from), and Caphtorim.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:13
text: Canaan became the father of Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:14
text: and the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:15
text: and the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:16
text: and the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:17
text: The sons of Shem: Elam, and Asshur, and Arpachshad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:18
text: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:19
text: To Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother"s name was Joktan.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:20
text: Joktan became the father of Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:21
text: and Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:22
text: and Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:23
text: and Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:24
text: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:25
text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:26
text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:27
text: Abram (the same is Abraham).

name: 1 Chronicles 1:28
text: The sons of Abraham: Isaac, and Ishmael.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:29
text: These are their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:30
text: Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:31
text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:32
text: The sons of Keturah, Abraham"s concubine: she bore Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba, and Dedan.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:33
text: The sons of Midian: Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:34
text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau, and Israel.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:35
text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:36
text: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:37
text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:38
text: The sons of Seir: Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:39
text: The sons of Lotan: Hori, and Homam; and Timna was Lotan"s sister.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:40
text: The sons of Shobal: Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah, and Anah.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:41
text: The sons of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hamran, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:42
text: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, and Zaavan, Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz, and Aran.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:43
text: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel: Bela the son of Beor; and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:44
text: Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:45
text: Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:46
text: Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who struck Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Avith.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:47
text: Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:48
text: Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth by the River reigned in his place.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:49
text: Shaul died, and Baal Hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:50
text: Baal Hanan died, and Hadad reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Pai: and his wife"s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

name: 1 Chronicles 1:51
text: Hadad died. The chiefs of Edom were: chief Timna, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:52
text: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:53
text: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,

name: 1 Chronicles 1:54
text: chief Magdiel, chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:1
text: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:2
text: Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:3
text: The sons of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah; which three were born to him of Shua"s daughter the Canaanitess. Er, Judah"s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of Yahweh; and he killed him.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:4
text: Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:5
text: The sons of Perez: Hezron, and Hamul.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:6
text: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara; five of them in all.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:7
text: The sons of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who committed a trespass in the devoted thing.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:8
text: The sons of Ethan: Azariah.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:9
text: The sons also of Hezron, who were born to him: Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:10
text: Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;

name: 1 Chronicles 2:11
text: and Nahshon became the father of Salma, and Salma became the father of Boaz,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:12
text: and Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse;

name: 1 Chronicles 2:13
text: and Jesse became the father of his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimea the third,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:14
text: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:15
text: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh;

name: 1 Chronicles 2:16
text: and their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:17
text: Abigail bore Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:18
text: Caleb the son of Hezron became the father of children of Azubah his wife, and of Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:19
text: Azubah died, and Caleb took to him Ephrath, who bore him Hur.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:20
text: Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:21
text: Afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he took as wife when he was sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:22
text: Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:23
text: Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath, and its villages, even sixty cities. All these were the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:24
text: After that Hezron was dead in Caleb Ephrathah, then Abijah Hezron"s wife bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:25
text: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were Ram the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, Ahijah.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:26
text: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:27
text: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:28
text: The sons of Onam were Shammai, and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab, and Abishur.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:29
text: The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bore him Ahban, and Molid.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:30
text: The sons of Nadab: Seled, and Appaim; but Seled died without children.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:31
text: The sons of Appaim: Ishi. The sons of Ishi: Sheshan. The sons of Sheshan: Ahlai.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:32
text: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether, and Jonathan; and Jether died without children.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:33
text: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:34
text: Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:35
text: Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant as wife; and she bore him Attai.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:36
text: Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan became the father of Zabad,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:37
text: and Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:38
text: and Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu became the father of Azariah,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:39
text: and Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez became the father of Eleasah,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:40
text: and Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai became the father of Shallum,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:41
text: and Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:42
text: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:43
text: The sons of Hebron: Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:44
text: Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:45
text: The son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:46
text: Ephah, Caleb"s concubine, bore Haran, and Moza, and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:47
text: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, and Jothan, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:48
text: Maacah, Caleb"s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:49
text: She bore also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena, and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:50
text: These were the sons of Caleb, the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,

name: 1 Chronicles 2:51
text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, Hareph the father of Beth Gader.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:52
text: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:53
text: The families of Kiriath Jearim: The Ithrites, and the Puthites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:54
text: The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, and the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.

name: 1 Chronicles 2:55
text: The families of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came of Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:1
text: Now these were the sons of David, who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second, Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess;

name: 1 Chronicles 3:2
text: the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;

name: 1 Chronicles 3:3
text: the fifth, Shephatiah of Abital; the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife:

name: 1 Chronicles 3:4
text: six were born to him in Hebron; and there he reigned seven years and six months. In Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years;

name: 1 Chronicles 3:5
text: and these were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon, four, of Bathshua the daughter of Ammiel;

name: 1 Chronicles 3:6
text: and Ibhar, and Elishama, and Eliphelet,

name: 1 Chronicles 3:7
text: and Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

name: 1 Chronicles 3:8
text: and Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:9
text: All these were the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines; and Tamar was their sister.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:10
text: Solomon"s son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 3:11
text: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 3:12
text: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 3:13
text: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 3:14
text: Amon his son, Josiah his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:15
text: The sons of Josiah: the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:16
text: The sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:17
text: The sons of Jeconiah, the captive: Shealtiel his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 3:18
text: and Malchiram, and Pedaiah, and Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:19
text: The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel, and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam, and Hananiah; and Shelomith was their sister;

name: 1 Chronicles 3:20
text: and Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, Jushab Hesed, five.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:21
text: The sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah, and Jeshaiah; the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shecaniah.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:22
text: The sons of Shecaniah: Shemaiah. The sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, and Igal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat, six.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:23
text: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, and Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three.

name: 1 Chronicles 3:24
text: The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Delaiah, and Anani, seven.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:1
text: The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and Shobal.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:2
text: Reaiah the son of Shobal became the father of Jahath; and Jahath became the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:3
text: These were the sons of the father of Etam: Jezreel, and Ishma, and Idbash; and the name of their sister was Hazzelelponi;

name: 1 Chronicles 4:4
text: and Penuel the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:5
text: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:6
text: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:7
text: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:8
text: Hakkoz became the father of Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:9
text: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers: and his mother named him Jabez, saying, "Because I bore him with sorrow."

name: 1 Chronicles 4:10
text: Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, "Oh that you would bless me indeed, and enlarge my border, and that your hand might be with me, and that you would keep me from evil, that it not be to my sorrow!" God granted him that which he requested.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:11
text: Chelub the brother of Shuhah became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:12
text: Eshton became the father of Beth Rapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These are the men of Recah.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:13
text: The sons of Kenaz: Othniel, and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel: Hathath.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:14
text: Meonothai became the father of Ophrah: and Seraiah became the father of Joab the father of Ge Harashim; for they were craftsmen.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:15
text: The sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the sons of Elah; and Kenaz.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:16
text: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:17
text: The sons of Ezrah: Jether, and Mered, and Epher, and Jalon; and she bore Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:18
text: His wife the Jewess bore Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. These are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:19
text: The sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:20
text: The sons of Shimon: Amnon, and Rinnah, Ben Hanan, and Tilon. The sons of Ishi: Zoheth, and Ben Zoheth.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:21
text: The sons of Shelah the son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of those who worked fine linen, of the house of Ashbea;

name: 1 Chronicles 4:22
text: and Jokim, and the men of Cozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had dominion in Moab, and Jashubilehem. The records are ancient.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:23
text: These were the potters, and the inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah: there they lived with the king for his work.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:24
text: The sons of Simeon: Nemuel, and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;

name: 1 Chronicles 4:25
text: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:26
text: The sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:27
text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers didn"t have many children, neither did all their family multiply like the children of Judah.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:28
text: They lived at Beersheba, and Moladah, and Hazarshual,

name: 1 Chronicles 4:29
text: and at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,

name: 1 Chronicles 4:30
text: and at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,

name: 1 Chronicles 4:31
text: and at Beth Marcaboth, and Hazar Susim, and at Beth Biri, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities to the reign of David.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:32
text: Their villages were Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities;

name: 1 Chronicles 4:33
text: and all their villages that were around the same cities, to Baal. These were their habitations, and they have their genealogy.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:34
text: Meshobab, and Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,

name: 1 Chronicles 4:35
text: and Joel, and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,

name: 1 Chronicles 4:36
text: and Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,

name: 1 Chronicles 4:37
text: and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah"

name: 1 Chronicles 4:38
text: these mentioned by name were princes in their families: and their fathers" houses increased greatly.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:39
text: They went to the entrance of Gedor, even to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:40
text: They found fat pasture and good, and the land was wide, and quiet, and peaceable; for those who lived there before were of Ham.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:41
text: These written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and struck their tents, and the Meunim who were found there, and destroyed them utterly to this day, and lived in their place; because there was pasture there for their flocks.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:42
text: Some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to Mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

name: 1 Chronicles 4:43
text: They struck the remnant of the Amalekites who escaped, and have lived there to this day.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:1
text: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn; but, because he defiled his father"s couch, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel; and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birthright.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:2
text: For Judah prevailed above his brothers, and of him came the prince; but the birthright was Joseph"s:)

name: 1 Chronicles 5:3
text: the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:4
text: The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 5:5
text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 5:6
text: Beerah his son, whom Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive: he was prince of the Reubenites.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:7
text: His brothers by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned: the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

name: 1 Chronicles 5:8
text: and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who lived in Aroer, even to Nebo and Baal Meon:

name: 1 Chronicles 5:9
text: and eastward he lived even to the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates, because their livestock were multiplied in the land of Gilead.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:10
text: In the days of Saul, they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they lived in their tents throughout all the land east of Gilead.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:11
text: The sons of Gad lived over against them, in the land of Bashan to Salecah:

name: 1 Chronicles 5:12
text: Joel the chief, and Shapham the second, and Janai, and Shaphat in Bashan.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:13
text: Their brothers of their fathers" houses: Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jacan, and Zia, and Eber, seven.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:14
text: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;

name: 1 Chronicles 5:15
text: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of their fathers" houses.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:16
text: They lived in Gilead in Bashan, and in its towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, as far as their borders.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:17
text: All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:18
text: The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, and to shoot with bow, and skillful in war, were forty-four thousand seven hundred and sixty, that were able to go forth to war.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:19
text: They made war with the Hagrites, with Jetur, and Naphish, and Nodab.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:20
text: They were helped against them, and the Hagrites were delivered into their hand, and all who were with them; for they cried to God in the battle, and he was entreated of them, because they put their trust in him.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:21
text: They took away their livestock; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred fifty thousand, and of donkeys two thousand, and of men one hundred thousand.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:22
text: For there fell many slain, because the war was of God. They lived in their place until the captivity.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:23
text: The children of the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land: they increased from Bashan to Baal Hermon and Senir and Mount Hermon.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:24
text: These were the heads of their fathers" houses: even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valor, famous men, heads of their fathers" houses.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:25
text: They trespassed against the God of their fathers, and played the prostitute after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God destroyed before them.

name: 1 Chronicles 5:26
text: The God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, and Habor, and Hara, and to the river of Gozan, to this day.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:1
text: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:2
text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:3
text: The children of Amram: Aaron, and Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:4
text: Eleazar became the father of Phinehas, Phinehas became the father of Abishua,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:5
text: and Abishua became the father of Bukki, and Bukki became the father of Uzzi,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:6
text: and Uzzi became the father of Zerahiah, and Zerahiah became the father of Meraioth,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:7
text: Meraioth became the father of Amariah, and Amariah became the father of Ahitub,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:8
text: and Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Ahimaaz,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:9
text: and Ahimaaz became the father of Azariah, and Azariah became the father of Johanan,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:10
text: and Johanan became the father of Azariah, (he it is who executed the priest"s office in the house that Solomon built in Jerusalem),

name: 1 Chronicles 6:11
text: and Azariah became the father of Amariah, and Amariah became the father of Ahitub,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:12
text: and Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Shallum,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:13
text: and Shallum became the father of Hilkiah, and Hilkiah became the father of Azariah,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:14
text: and Azariah became the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah became the father of Jehozadak;

name: 1 Chronicles 6:15
text: Jehozadak went into captivity, when Yahweh carried away Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:16
text: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:17
text: These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:18
text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:19
text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers" households.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:20
text: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:21
text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeatherai his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:22
text: The sons of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:23
text: Elkanah his son, and Ebiasaph his son, and Assir his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:24
text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:25
text: The sons of Elkanah: Amasai, and Ahimoth.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:26
text: As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah: Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:27
text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:28
text: The sons of Samuel: the firstborn Joel, and the second Abijah.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:29
text: The sons of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:30
text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:31
text: These are they whom David set over the service of song in the house of Yahweh, after that the ark had rest.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:32
text: They ministered with song before the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting, until Solomon had built the house of Yahweh in Jerusalem: and they waited on their office according to their order.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:33
text: These are those who waited, and their sons. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:34
text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:35
text: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:36
text: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:37
text: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:38
text: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:39
text: His brother Asaph, who stood on his right hand, even Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:40
text: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:41
text: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:42
text: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:43
text: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:44
text: On the left hand their brothers the sons of Merari: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:45
text: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:46
text: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:47
text: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:48
text: Their brothers the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of the house of God.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:49
text: But Aaron and his sons offered on the altar of burnt offering, and on the altar of incense, for all the work of the most holy place, and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:50
text: These are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:51
text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:52
text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:53
text: Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:54
text: Now these are their dwelling places according to their encampments in their borders: to the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites (for theirs was the first lot),

name: 1 Chronicles 6:55
text: to them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah, and its suburbs around it;

name: 1 Chronicles 6:56
text: but the fields of the city, and its villages, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:57
text: To the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of refuge, Hebron; Libnah also with its suburbs, and Jattir, and Eshtemoa with its suburbs,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:58
text: and Hilen with its suburbs, Debir with its suburbs,

name: 1 Chronicles 6:59
text: and Ashan with its suburbs, and Beth Shemesh with its suburbs;

name: 1 Chronicles 6:60
text: and out of the tribe of Benjamin, Geba with its suburbs, and Allemeth with its suburbs, and Anathoth with its suburbs. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:61
text: To the rest of the sons of Kohath were given by lot, out of the family of the tribe, out of the half-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten cities.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:62
text: To the sons of Gershom, according to their families, out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:63
text: To the sons of Merari were given by lot, according to their families, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:64
text: The children of Israel gave to the Levites the cities with their suburbs.

name: 1 Chronicles 6:65
